page.title: 16 THE ELDERLY POPULATION
page.content: There are several blocks of sheltered flats in our area. Some of them are owned by the private Servite Houses Ltd, an independent registered charity started in 1944, so called because the first block built was on land owned by the Servites. Residents have to be of retirement age and reasonably able-bodied. The cost per week is about Â£30 for a single flat, Â£32 for a double, including rent, general rate, water rate, service charge, all heating and domestic hot water, use of common room and laundry. Special facilities provided include alarm cords in every room and poles by toilets and baths for extra support. Near the common room there is a warden's flat in which alarms ring so help is available day or night. Some flats have separate entrances while others are entirely under one roof.
